title: What is the definition of imperialism? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my reading — The root word of Imperialism is “Empire.” Thus, just as the 19th century British Empire was an open form of Imperialism, so were the French, Spanish and the Holy Roman Empires. Going back thousands of years from that point, we had the Roman Empire (ca. 100 BC), the Greek Empire (ca. 300 BC), the Persian Empire (ca. 500 BC), the Babylonian Empire (ca. 700 BC), the Assyrian Empire (ca. 900 BC), the Egyptian Empire (ca 2,500 BC) and the Chinese Empire (ca. 3,000 BC). In short — the most common form of any large government for the past 5,000 years has been Imperialism. “Empire” is also the root word of Emperor. Santa Anna tried to make himself an Emperor. So did Napoleon. It’s all too human. There’s my reading.
